page.title: 16WOODLANDS
page.content: Immediately behind our school we have a small wood. There are different kinds of trees like Oak, Rowan, Sycamore and Elderberry. We went to measure the height of the trees with a clinometer. The Sycamore is l2 metres, Rowan 18metres and the Oak tree is l3 metres. The smallest is the Elderberry at 7 metres. Some of the Oak trees in our woods are l00 years old. We have got some wild flowers like Cow Parsley. Cow Parsley can be called Lady's Lace. It has got thin stems and white flowers. There are lots of minibeasts. When we went down in the Woods we found Wood Lice, Slugs, beetles and Frog Hoppers. There are also different fungi in the wood, one is called Birch Bracket which grows on dead trees - it is brown and white. by pupils from BRANFIL SCHOOL.
